title: I dislike Cassiopeia's stacking passive.
body:
It's simply a 35 minute compensation for having her old ratios scrapped and her earlygame weakened.
Even the CDR is just a poor apology for increasing the cooldown on her Q by 33%.
The lifesteal is the only real feature gained and to be honest - it doesn't even make sense!
Is she a vampire now?
---------------------------------------------
I appreciate Stashu's effort to fix this broken rework.
But I can't see it working out if her passive is solely based on compensating what was taken away from her and a single added bonus which doesn't even make sense lore or gameply wise.
-------------------------------------
It could be fun if her stacking passive was about adding utility to her poison, like adding Magic Resist Shred, Slows or lowering the enemies attack damage.

Currently however it's just dull and unrewarding. I dare say that old Cassio players will never accept it as long as it's sole purpose consists in manipulating her powercurve to have a worse earlygame.

replies.body: Hey! Thanks for sharing your thoughts. The sole purpose of the passive is not to compensate what was taken away, but I can definitely see how it appears to be that way. A big part of it *was* to curb the oppressive lane bully pattern, but the other parts were to offer her a unique way of growing in power that was meant to be exciting and rewarding. As you say, however, it's landed in a place that's a bit dull. Were working on making sure we've get some poison feel back and get her into a balanced state, largely by flattening out her ridiculously steep power curve a bit. This'll likely hit in 4.21, and it's likely that the passive will still feel a bit flat even on a balanced champion, so we'll be evaluating that as we go and be ready to make changes to make feel less like a shackle and more like a cool way of growing power.

We don't WANT a power growing passive though. That's what you want, and not to be rude but most of us don't care if you're having a ton of fun. WE want to have a ton of fun, and a stacking passive is keeping that from happening.

You're, uh... You're like Aang in that scene with the past avatars. "This isn't about you" is what the air bender lady says, or something like that. Your sole duty is to the players.

"Here is my wisdom for you. Selfless duty calls upon you to sacrifice your own needs, and do whatever it takes to protect the world." Or save the snake lady. Whatever. It's not a perfect metaphor but it's an Avatar metaphor, and if you don't think Avatar is the tightest shit then get out of my face.

This, this and even more of this. 

Some alternative passives:

Her original passive (solves her mana issues, explained below)
X less damage from poisoned targets (some more defense so she isn't as unbearably squishy) 
Each tick of poison on a champion/use of Twin Fang on a poisoned champion heals Cass for X (or gives her a shield; fang could heal for double; better sustain in lane and dueling survivability)
Reduce her ulti's cooldown 1s for each X seconds an enemy champion is poisoned (better defense later in the game; definitely my least favorite)

Could probably think of more.

Other changes she needs:

Miasma deals 150% damage to minions (or, conversely, to champions) making it a better farming tool (or better harassing tool)

Reduce her mana costs across the board and remove the mana regen on E. Better yet, do so while restoring her passive (which would make her a *better* lategame carry, since she'd have the mana reserves to spam without needing to prioritize RoA/Seraphs)

**Encouraging the Cass player to last hit with E is silly and puts her in a LOT of danger. It should never have been emphasized in the first place, and it should be abolished. She needs to be able to farm reliably with Q and W if you want her to survive the lane phase; getting into E range to last hit caster creeps is quite literally begging to be jumped on and killed.**

There, I just fixed Cass. You're welcome.

If the changes you suggest were to happen, she would go back to being the sort of lane bully that is completely terrible to play against. She not only needs reasonable trade offs, but clear and distinct points where someone playing against her has the ability to possibly counter attack. Most of the comments in this thread are about making her stronger, or shifting her to a point where she can safely poison, and face little to no repercussions.

I'd rather she be terrible to play against than terrible to play, at least until a compromise can be settled. She wasn't game-breaking, she wasn't permabanned, she wasn't so dominant that *no one* could lane against her nor win against her late. 

Right now she is unbearable to play and has the worst winrate of any champion--and that winrate is only getting worse. The PBE changes have done absolutely nothing to change how unfun and weak she is, and I am sick of waiting for more small tweaks that will change absolutely nothing.

She needs certain things to function properly. Those are what I suggested. Anything less would change *nothing*.

This was the compromise. Any champion is better left weak, than game ruining, especially given that has a much bigger impact on the community at large, than just a single champion being slightly sub par.

More so, Cass had the same issues WW or other older champs have, in that they aren't necessarily a good pick most of the time, but when they are picked it's because their older niches are just so much more abusable and easy. Blitz, Nasus, Amumu, WW, Yi, Morde, and other champions are good examples of this. If a champion was truly terrible then you wouldn't see pro's be able to do so well with them, as if they were just another random pick.  

So while Cass wasn't necessarily the bane of other midlanes preceding her rework, her kit and play style when successful; did still promote her bad qualities. Now while there is a case she maybe feels "off", the comments referring to her being weak or helpless in most lanes seems alittle disingenuous. Especially given in equal skill levels someone like Voyboy can turn on most other mids without too much of a problem.

I do (honestly) think you probably can come up with a change to Cass that is actually healthy, but it's important to remember everything comes with trade offs, and being able to Q W a wave, and then Qing an enemy champion while receiving little to no counter attacks. Because this isn't really about making Cass "better", that's easy. But making her engaging, and having little toxic elements in their kit is the most important matter. Good luck with the forum crusading!

If being able to clear a wave with a couple of skillcasts from range--and still be able to harass--is toxic, then **nearly every ranged mid-laner is toxic**.

Ahri, Anivia, Annie, Azir, Brand, Gragas, Heimerdinger, Janna, Jayce, Karma, Karthus, LeBlanc, Lissandra, Lux, Malzahar, Morgana, Orianna, Syndra, Veigar, Vel'koz, Viktor, Xerath, Ziggs *and* Zyra are not all toxic, yet they can all harass at range while reliably clearing waves quickly and with few casts. 

Why can't Cass be allowed to do the same? If she cannot, she is *not playable.* She was not dominating matches, she was not ruining solo queue nor running rampant in competitive play. She was doing nothing to demonstrate her supposed toxicity. One day Riot decided she was toxic, simply by saying "guys this is toxic k." 

She was dominating Treeline, sure, but Riot has repeatedly said they don't give a flying fuck about Treeline balance, so why should that have had any effect on their decision? That was her only sin: too strong on Treeline. 

The rework was not only unnecessary but left her in an unplayable, horrid state that is neither fun nor compelling. She's below trash tier and she will remain so until she is either overhauled completely (moreso than Sion, even) or returned to the state she was in. "Toxic" my ass. 

If they really, really want to rework her then they should've figured out a good way to do it *before* changing her, and especially before pushing changes that were reviled on the PBE to live. But Riot's testing process is "herp derp this is cool right??? it doesnt crash the game? awesome! lets put it in! Oh, they dont like it? Too bad! Put it in anyway and we can fix it later if we remember."

At this point I'd rather they removed her from the game and made a new champion from scratch. You can't take the fun parts of a champion out and put jack shit in its place and expect people to like it. This is no compromise, this is "fuck you, that thing you like is total shit and you're shit for liking it."

I really don't know were you are coming from with this point:

Her passive is LITERALLY giving her back everything that she lost during the rework.  It gives her more AP, to deal with the fact that her ratios were smashed so you need almost double the AP in order to do the same amount of damage.  Which means shes glass on a low range immobile champ.  It gives her CDR so that she can spam the spells which had CD increases during the rework.  And it stacks and has to take time to power up.  All together, what you did was just reduce everything that made Cassiopeia good, attach it to her passive and say "well, you can have this back after 40 minutes."  You also made it so that her entire kit revolves around her E, making it so that if she doesn't land 4-5 E's, she might have well had not even spent the mana on a Q.

Your rework is terrible and took Cass in the opposite direction that it should have

I feel that this passive is A) not balanceable in a way that feels satisfying and B) not fit for Cass.

So A). Sure, it's great to get 1200 AP, but that doesn't mean much when your ratios aren't that great. And they HAVE to be 'not that great' because you CAN get to 1200 AP. Having, say, Malz-esque ratios (.8, .8, 1.3, 1% per 100) would make things ridiculous, so her ratios have to be worse. Sure, late game, you can do good damage. You can certainly become the late game hyper carry and destroy things that you want her to be (assuming you don't die). But you don't do the damage you'd expect from being able to say 'I have 1200 AP'. Plus, those bad ratios mean that early game, before you get your stacks and your items, your AP means basically nothing.

B) Why this passive? For what purpose? This doesn't match old Cass (and even the connections to new Cass are tenuous and your explanation really made it seem like you were reaching and desperate to explain yourself), and considering I started playing Cass for old Cass, that's a problem. Are we going to see a rework to Ziggs or Syndra that makes them late game hyper carries? I trust that you're trying to make things right, but I don't see HOW things could be right as long as you stick to this passive. Unfortunately, you REALLY seem to like this passive. Why do you think this is a good passive? Try to explain this to me as an old Cass player. Don't go into game health, or use new lore to justify this. Explain to me, an old Cass player, why I would want to continue playing new Cass. Please.

Ima just copy-pasta this:

**I'd say give her the tools early to sustain in lane and waveclear, with a natural fall-off come late-game. To compensate have the Passive grant bouses that strengthen her sustained DPS playstyle.**

This would be **a curse;** at first she's just a shy little snake-lady scared and dieing. but the poison in her grows stronger until, in the end she's a ruthless predator.

This would play into the troubles you're having right now, you cant increase her waveclear/poke damage too much, because that would turn her into a poke/lanebully, but puttting all her power in E from the start would either make her too strong 1v1 and/or leave her too weak to waveclear and too heavily mana-gated. Alot of the problems you're having is because** the bonuses you give** (aside from the E lifesteal *hint hint*) **are general and apply to all playstyles and abilities, rather than bonuses that single out and enhance a particular aspect.**

**The E lifesteal is a generally loved mechanic and should be the path to follow.** **rather than general stats.** You will always have trouble balancing her kit, unless you make the bonuses more specific and hence much easier to control.

So I'd say fuck it, give her the tools to waveclear early with high base damages and low Ratio's then grant higher ratios on E and add meaningfull mechanics on the passive that enhance her DPS/predator style that are separate from stats gained through items. Sustain through lifesteal, kiting tools through Movespeed, execute damage through %missing health damage, E enhancing Poison etc.

**It's adapt or die; ****you need to embrace the curse** and go full beast-mode late game with an E-focused playstyle to be succesful.

You are having trouble with a shackled feeling; but that's because **your solutions are too general (AP and CDR)**. Just grant her enough of one type of power early that falls off, to be replaced through the passive by another type of power (power that cant be found through items/stats). With your current passive, you take away power early through Cooldowns, ratio's and base damages (so Cass wont abuse a poke/bully playstyle) to give her back in late-game that same power you took (in the hopes that they will use this power for the playstyle you envision).

ps: Have you considered the Q's MS boost starting higher and decaying over time? with an over-time equal movespeed, but I really feel this would make it more interesting with valuable pro's and cons while giving it a stronger "snake-slither" feel.
pps: I know some of these suggestions you have already replied upon, but I feel your answers were very dismissive/defensive and from the POV of keeping your passive and THEN adding those mechanics.

Then old Cass players are free to reminisce about the good ol' days. The bottom line is that Riot made her that wasy specifically to reduce her power curve during the first half hour of a match. If the enemy team has a Cass, it means they have a severe disadvantage where the midlane is concerned. If your team fails to capitalize on it and lets her survive well enough to hit her power curve in the late game, it's no one else's fault but you and your teammates'.
